title: UI/UX Designer – Web Application Redesign (Contract Position)
description:
About the Role

We are looking for an experienced UI/UX Designer to review the existing screens of a large web-based system and redesign the user interface to make it more modern, intuitive, and user-friendly.
This role is design-only — no coding or development is required. You will work closely with our team to deliver high-quality design mockups, layouts, and UI improvements.

What You Will Do
• Review dozens of existing screens across our web application
• Identify usability issues, layout inconsistencies, and improvement opportunities
• Redesign screens with a clean, modern UI that makes workflows easier for users
• Produce high-fidelity designs using tools such as Figma, Adobe XD, or Sketch
• Create standardized UI components and design guidelines
• Collaborate with our development team to clarify design logic when needed
• Deliver organized design files and assets ready for handoff to developers

Requirements
• Proven experience in UI/UX design for web applications
• Strong portfolio showing modern UI design work
• Expertise in design tools: Figma, Adobe XD, Sketch, or similar
• Ability to understand complex workflows and simplify user interfaces
• Strong attention to detail and consistency
• Excellent communication skills
• Ability to work independently and deliver high-quality results on time

Nice to Have
• Experience designing dashboards or ERP-style systems
• Familiarity with responsive web layouts
• Understanding of UX principles and user-centered workflows
• Ability to create simple click-through prototypes

Project Details
• Contract project (duration depends on number of screens and complexity)
• Flexible schedule
• Competitive compensation based on experience
• Opportunity to work on a large-scale enterprise system used daily by hundreds of users

Job Types: Part-time, Fixed term contract
Contract length: 12 months

Pay: From $20.00 per hour

Expected hours: 30 – 40 per week

Ability to commute/relocate:
• Mississauga, ON L5L 5Y1: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Application question(s):
• Please Provide your linked-in profile URL
• Please provide a link to your UI/UX portfolio showing web application designs (not just websites).
• Have you previously redesigned an existing system (multiple screens) rather than creating a design from scratch?
• Describe your typical UI/UX design process when improving an already-built system.
• How soon can you start, and how many hours per week can you dedicate to this project?

Experience:
• UI/UX: 2 years (required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Mississauga, ON L5L 5Y1

title: Junior UI/UX Designer
description:
Charger logistics Inc. is a world- class asset-based carrier with locations across North America. With over 20 years of experience providing the best logistics solutions, Charger logistics has transformed into a world-class transport provider and continue to grow.

We’re looking for a creative and curious Junior UI/UX Designer to join our design team. If you love clean, modern design, enjoy using AI tools, and want to create user-friendly digital experiences, this role is for you.

You’ll design responsive web interfaces, help test ideas with real users, and work closely with developers to turn your designs into working products.
• *Responsibilities:**

- Design modern, responsive websites that work well on all devices.
- Use AI tools in Figma to speed up design workflows.
- Create wireframes, user flows, and interactive prototypes.
- Build and maintain design systems and components.
- Conduct user research and usability testing to improve designs.
- Work with developers to ensure designs are feasible and consistent.

### Requirements
• *Technical Skills**

- 6 months-2 years experience designing responsive web/mobile applications.
- Basic knowledge of HTML/CSS, Flexbox, and CSS Grid.
- Familiarity with React concepts: components, props, and state.
- Awareness of React Native for mobile design.
- Version control basics (Git, GitHub).
• *Design Skills**

- Strong proficiency in **Figma**, including:

- Auto-layout, components, and design systems.
- Prototyping and interactive design.
- Use of AI features (First Draft, image generation, etc.).
- Experience with plugins (e.g. Automator, Unbackground).

- Good understanding of UI/UX strategies and methodologies.
- Excellent understanding of **responsive** and **mobile-first** design.
- Knowledge of **component architecture** and how designs translate into code (especially React).
- Solid grasp of **visual design**- typography, color, layout, and hierarchy.
- Ability to conduct **user research**, usability testing, and analyze results.
• *Nice to Have**

- Experience with other design tools: Adobe XD, Sketch, Framer.
- Understanding of **Tailwind CSS** and utility-first design.
- Familiarity with UI libraries like **Material UI, Chakra UI, or shadcn/ui.**
- Motion design skills (After Effects, Principle).
- Basic knowledge of JavaScript/TypeScript.

### Benefits

- Competitive Salary
- Healthcare Benefit Package
- Career Growth

title: Business Intelligence Analyst (Finance)
description:
Description

At CDW, we make it happen, together. Trust, connection, and commitment are at the heart of how we work together to deliver for our customers. It’s why we’re coworkers, not just employees. Coworkers who genuinely believe in supporting our customers and one another. We collectively forge our path forward with a level of commitment that speaks to who we are and where we’re headed. We’re proud to share our story and Make Amazing Happen at CDW.

Reporting to the Manager, Business Intelligence, the Business Intelligence Analyst is a subject matter expert providing financial and operational visibility across the organization. The individual collaborates with key stakeholders in Finance, Sales, and Services to identify business questions, develop financial insights, and present actionable analyses to support strategic and operational decision-making. The BI Analyst leverages both leading and lagging indicators to evaluate business performance and identify opportunities for improvement in people, process, and tools.

What you’ll do
• Design and develop financial and operational dashboards and reports (e.g., Power BI) to track performance, forecast trends, and monitor KPIs across Sales and Finance functions
• Support financial planning and forecasting processes, including variance analysis, revenue and expense tracking
• Provide analytical support for budgeting, scenario modeling, and strategic planning activities
• Automate existing financial reports and recommend process improvements to enhance efficiency and accuracy
• Analyze data to identify trends, risks, and opportunities impacting business performance
• Advise leadership on financial insights, business drivers, and implications of data findings
• Recommend and implement new data or analytical solutions to support evolving business needs
• Ensure data integrity and alignment between financial systems and BI tools
• Partner with the finance and sales teams to benchmark performance and identify actionable recommendations

What you need to succeed

Must-have
• Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Analytics, or a related field (or equivalent experience)
• 5+ years of experience in financial analysis, planning, or business intelligence
• Strong proficiency in Power BI and Microsoft Excel (advanced modeling and forecasting)
• Proven ability to translate financial data into clear insights and business recommendations
• Strong communication skills with the ability to influence and collaborate across departments
• Demonstrated capability to manage multiple priorities, adapt to business needs, and meet deadlines
• Ability to synthesize complex data into meaningful business narratives

Nice-to-have
• Experience with SQL, relational databases, or financial modeling tools
• Background in Professional or Managed Services industries
• Knowledge of data governance and financial system integration

At CDW, we strive to offer market-competitive total rewards packages to attract and retain talent. As such, we are committed to pay transparency and ensuring fair compensation for all our coworkers. Each of our roles is assigned a salary range that is informed by multiple sources of market data. We determine individual pay within a given range based on a candidate's prior experience, knowledge, skills and abilities. This approach allows us to offer competitive and equitable salaries that reflect the value and responsibilities of each role at CDW. Salaries are based on a 40-hour workweek, and paid on a bi-weekly payroll schedule.

Pay range: $ 66,000 - $ 82,000, depending on experience and skill set

We make technology work so people can do great things.    

CDW is a leading multi-brand provider of information technology solutions to business, government, education and healthcare customers in the United States, the United Kingdom and Canada. A Fortune 500 company and member of the S&P 500 Index, CDW helps its customers to navigate an increasingly complex IT market and maximize return on their technology investments. Together, we unite. Together, we win. Together, we thrive.

CDW is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other basis prohibited by state and local law. 

CDW is committed to fostering an equitable, transparent, and respectful hiring process for all applicants. During our application process, CDW’s goal is to get to know you as an applicant and understand your experience, strengths, skills, and qualifications. While AI can help you present yourself more clearly and effectively, the essence of your application should be authentically yours. To learn more, please review CDW's AI Applicant Notice.

title: Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst
description:
Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst – 1 year term

About Avenir Energy Ltd.
Avenir Energy Ltd. is one of Canada’s largest and fastest-growing propane distribution companies. We are a fast-paced, customer-focused, field-based business with operations across the country and a commitment to excellence. With over 400 dedicated team members, we are driven to become the propane distributor of choice in North America.
At Avenir Energy, we offer a dynamic, respectful, and collaborative work environment where every team member plays a key role in our success.

Position Summary
As a Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst, you will support the development and maintenance of data reports, dashboards, and analytical tools that help business teams make informed decisions. You’ll work with Power BI and SQL to turn data into insights, ensuring information is accurate, accessible, and aligned with business needs. This role is ideal for someone who enjoys problem-solving, data visualization, and collaborating across departments.
• Please note, this is a 1 year term role*

Key Responsibilities
• Collect, clean, and analyze large data sets from multiple sources to ensure accuracy and consistency.
• Develop and maintain Power BI dashboards and reports to monitor key business metrics and support data-driven decision-making.
• Identify trends, patterns, and insights that help guide business strategy and performance improvement.
• Write and optimize SQL queries to extract, transform, and validate data for reporting and analysis.
• Collaborate with stakeholders to define requirements and translate business needs into effective analytical solutions.
• Support data quality, governance, and process improvement initiatives to enhance reporting reliability and efficiency.

Qualifications
• Bachelor’s degree or diploma in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Analytics, or a related field.
• 3–5 years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or analytics.
• Proficiency in Power BI, including report creation and dashboard design.
• Strong knowledge of MS SQL Server and SQL query development.
• Familiarity with data visualization and data modeling concepts,
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
• Effective communication and collaboration skills for working with both technical and non-technical users.
• Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
• Asset: Certification such as Microsoft Power BI Data Analyst Associate; experience with Excel, cloud BI platform
• Asset: ETL tools and processes, data ingestion, and architecture.

Avenir Energy is committed to accommodating applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process. Please let us know if you require accommodation at any stage. By applying, you acknowledge that Avenir Energy may use third-party systems that employ Artificial Intelligence in recruiting and that employment offers are contingent on the completion of background checks, as required by company policy.
We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
McKesson is an impact-driven, Fortune 10 company that touches virtually every aspect of healthcare. We are known for delivering insights, products, and services that make quality care more accessible and affordable. Here, we focus on the health, happiness, and well-being of you and those we serve – we care.

What you do at McKesson matters. We foster a culture where you can grow, make an impact, and are empowered to bring new ideas. Together, we thrive as we shape the future of health for patients, our communities, and our people. If you want to be part of tomorrow’s health today, we want to hear from you.

Rejoignez l’équipe d’analytique des génériques au sein de la division technologique de McKesson en tant qu’Analyste en Intelligence d’Affaires. Ce rôle soutient la prise de décisions stratégiques en développant et en maintenant des tableaux de bord et des analyses axés sur les indicateurs clés de performance.

Ce que vous ferez
• Analyser et interpréter les données pour soutenir les décisions commerciales, en présentant les résultats sous forme de rapports, tableaux de bord, graphiques, etc.
• Collaborer avec les parties prenantes pour transformer des problématiques ambiguës en solutions analytiques structurées.
• Identifier des opportunités d’amélioration des processus et recommander des optimisations opérationnelles.
• Concevoir des modèles d’apprentissage automatique (ex. : régression, regroupement, prévision de séries temporelles) pour soutenir les initiatives de tarification, de segmentation et d’optimisation des campagnes.
• Développer des visualisations et tableaux de bord dans Power BI pour communiquer les résultats à des publics non techniques.
• Réaliser des tests A/B et des simulations de scénarios pour évaluer les stratégies de tarification et de campagnes.
• Travailler en collaboration avec les membres de l’équipe pour assurer la livraison ponctuelle de produits analytiques de haute qualité.

Ce que vous apportez
• Maîtrise de Snowflake, SQL, Python, Databricks et Power BI.
• Solide compréhension des méthodes statistiques, des algorithmes d’apprentissage automatique et de la modélisation des données.
• Excellentes compétences en communication écrite et orale.
• Capacité à gérer plusieurs tâches et à travailler efficacement sous pression dans un environnement dynamique.
• Sens aigu du détail et excellentes compétences organisationnelles.
• Aptitudes avérées à la résolution de problèmes et à la pensée critique.
• Intelligence émotionnelle et conscience de soi démontrées.

Exigences minimales
• Diplôme ou équivalent et nécessite généralement 4 ans ou plus d’expérience pertinente.

Compétences et expériences souhaitées
• Diplôme de niveau licence ou master en science des données, analytique, informatique ou domaine connexe.
• Plus de 5 ans d’expérience dans le domaine de la science des données ou de l’analytique.
• Expérience en tests A/B et en simulations de scénarios.
• Connaissance des stratégies de tarification et d’optimisation des campagnes.

Note linguistique : Le/la titulaire de ce poste devra fournir un soutien quotidien à des clients internes et/ou externes situés hors du Québec et/ou aux États-Unis. Par conséquent, une maîtrise de l’anglais parlé et écrit est requise. Veuillez noter que le nombre de postes nécessitant des compétences en anglais a été limité autant que possible.

_____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Summary

Join McKesson’s Generics Analytics team within the Technology division as a Business Intelligence Analyst. In this role, you’ll drive strategic decision-making by developing and maintaining analytics insights and dashboards that illuminate key business performance metrics.

What You’ll Do
• Analyze and interpret data to support business decisions, presenting insights via reports, dashboards, charts, and graphs.
• Collaborate with stakeholders to translate ambiguous business problems into structured analytical solutions.
• Identify and recommend process improvements based on operational analysis.
• Build machine learning models (e.g., regression, clustering, time series forecasting) to support pricing, segmentation, and campaign optimization.
• Develop Power BI dashboards and visualizations to communicate insights to non-technical audiences.
• Conduct A/B testing and scenario simulations to evaluate pricing and campaign strategies.
• Work collaboratively with team members to ensure timely delivery of high-quality analytics products.

What You Bring
• Strong working knowledge of Snowflake, SQL, Python, Databricks, and Power BI.
• Deep understanding of statistical methods, machine learning algorithms, and data modeling.
• Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.
• Ability to manage multiple tasks and work effectively under pressure in a fast-paced environment.
• Exceptional attention to detail and organizational skills.
• Proven problem-solving and critical thinking abilities.
• Demonstrated self-awareness and emotional intelligence.

Minimum Requirements
• Degree or equivalent and typically requires 4+ years of relevant experience.

Preferable Skills & Experience
• Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Analytics, Computer Science, or a related field.
• 5+ years of experience in data science or analytics.
• Experience conducting A/B testing and scenario simulations.
• Familiarity with pricing and campaign optimization strategies.

The incumbent of this position will provide daily support to internal and/or external clients outside Quebec and/or in the United States. Therefore, he/she must be proficient in spoken and written English. Please note that the number of positions requiring English language skills has been limited where possible.

We are proud to offer a competitive compensation package at McKesson as part of our Total Rewards. This is determined by several factors, including performance, experience and skills, equity, regular job market evaluations, and geographical markets. The pay range shown below is aligned with McKesson's pay philosophy, and pay will always be compliant with any applicable regulations. In addition to base pay, other compensation, such as an annual bonus or long-term incentive opportunities may be offered. For more information regarding benefits at McKesson, please click here.

Our Base Pay Range for this position

$70,600 - $117,600

McKesson is an Equal Opportunity Employer

McKesson provides equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees and is committed to a diverse and inclusive environment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, age or genetic information. For additional information on McKesson’s full Equal Employment Opportunity policies, visit our Equal Employment Opportunity page.

Join us at McKesson!

title: Business Intelligence Report Analyst
description:
Position Profile

Humber River Health. Lighting New Ways In Healthcare.

Since opening our doors in 2015 as North America’s first fully digital hospital, we remain unwavering in our belief that we can change the hospital where we work, the community where we live, and the world of healthcare beyond our borders. Serving a community of 850,000 residents in North West Toronto, Equity Inclusivity and active participation in the North West Toronto Ontario Health Team are key initiatives important to our Team. At Humber River Health, we use a custom combination of technology and clinical expertise to rebuild elements of care. We make technology work for staff and physicians; giving them more time to spend with patients, to eliminate inefficiencies, and to reduce the chance of errors. Humber River Health is formally affiliated with both the University of Toronto and Queen’s University and committed to becoming a community academic hospital. Clinical Excellence, Optimizing Care through Technology and Community Connection frame our Research Strategy.

At Humber River Health, we’re not hoping for a renaissance, we are making it happen. As part of our dynamic team, you can lead the way, as we continue our journey towards high reliability care!

We currently have an exciting opportunity for a Business Intelligence Report Analyst to join our growing Analytics and Business Insight team. Do you have the skill and the passion to turn raw data into visualized business and clinical insight? Do you enjoy creating dashboard and other analytical solutions? Then this might be the job for you.

Employment Status: Full-timeReporting Relationship: Manager of Analytics and BI Reporting

Schedule Requirements: Must be available to work Monday to Friday. Occasional weekend work may be required.

Location: Wilson Site / hybrid work from home

Employee Group: Non Union

Position Responsibilities:
• Collaborate with stakeholders to understand analytical requirements, business goals and metrics
• Partner with cross-functional teams and subject matter experts to understand business needs and translate them into data requirements.
• Translate user requirements into visual, analytical and dashboard solutions
• Work with Business Intelligence Developers and other IT staff on dataset creation and optimization
• Develop and maintain complex data models, reports, visualizations, and dashboards using BI tools (e.g., MicroStrategy, Power BI, Tableau).
• Create and maintain data models, datasets, and central dashboards
• Conduct training sessions of new and existing dashboards to key stakeholders and users such as Managers, Directors and VP’s

Primary Qualifications:
• Undergrad degree in Computer Science, Health Information Management or Business Management
• Certification or proven experience in Power BI, MicroStrategy or Tableau
• 3 years of experience with programming languages and tools such as [SQL, Python, R, SAS] and simple analytics tools such as [Excel]
• Experience using data visualization tools such as [Power BI, Tableau, MicroStrategy] to create compelling visualizations and reports
• Strong analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracy
• Commitment to continuous learning and willingness to stay updated on emerging industry trends, business processes, technologies, and methodologies in the data field
• Strong organizational, communication and collaboration skills
• Excellent attendance and discipline free record required

Why choose Humber River Health?

At Humber River Health, our staff, physicians, and volunteers are lighting new ways in healthcare. We are proud to be recognized as a part of Greater Toronto’s Top Employers by Mediacorp Canada Inc. We support employees by providing evidence-based leadership and cultivating a culture that consistently wows with our unwavering commitment to Staff, Physician and Volunteer engagement. We are a member of the Toronto Academic Health Science Network (TAHSN) and are deeply involved in research and academic collaboration. We are dedicated to high-quality patient care and demonstrate our values of compassion, professionalism, and respect.

Attracting and retaining a workforce that represents the diverse communities surrounding Humber River Health, is a priority. We encourage applicants from all equity-deserving groups, including but not limited to, individuals who identity as Indigenous, racialized, seniors, persons living with disabilities, women, and those who identify as 2SLGBTQ.

Applicants will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, religion, disability, medical condition, or any protected category prohibited by the Ontario Human Rights Code and Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act.

Accommodations are available throughout the recruitment process as well as during employment at Humber River Health. Please direct any accommodation requests to our recruitment team.

title: Senior Power BI Developer
description:
Role: Senior Power BI Developer

Rate: 60-70/hr

Role: Hybrid

Job Summary

As a Power BI Developer , you will be responsible for creating Power BI reports based on the requirements. You will utilize your expertise in Power BI Service, MS Power BI, and data modeling to drive project success. This role requires a hybrid work model with no travel obligations, focusing on day shifts.

Responsibilities
• - Lead the planning and execution of projects, ensuring they meet organizational objectives and timelines.
• Oversee the integration of Power BI Service and MS Power BI into project workflows to enhance data visualization and reporting capabilities.
• Provide guidance on data modeling techniques within Power BI to optimize data analysis and decision-making processes.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless project delivery and stakeholder satisfaction.
• Monitor project progress and implement corrective actions to address any deviations from planned outcomes.
• Develop and maintain project documentation, including status reports and risk assessments, to ensure transparency and accountability.
• Facilitate regular meetings with project teams to discuss progress, challenges, and solutions.
• Ensure compliance with industry standards and best practices in project management and data handling.
• Drive continuous improvement initiatives to enhance project efficiency and effectiveness.
• Utilize your expertise in Power BI to provide insights and recommendations that support strategic decision-making.
• Coordinate with IT and data teams to ensure the availability and reliability of data resources for project needs.
• Foster a collaborative environment that encourages innovation and problem-solving among team members.
• Evaluate project outcomes and provide feedback to stakeholders to inform future project planning.

Qualifications
• Eligible for Pro-B Clearance - Must have
• Possess a strong background in Power BI Service and MS Power BI, with proven experience in data modeling techniques.
• Demonstrate excellent project management skills, with a focus on delivering projects on time and within scope.
• Exhibit strong analytical abilities, capable of interpreting complex data sets and providing actionable insights.
• Have experience working in a hybrid work model, adapting to both remote and in-office environments.
• Show proficiency in stakeholder management, ensuring clear communication and alignment with project goals.
• Display a commitment to continuous learning and staying updated with the latest advancements in Power BI and project management.
• Hold a bachelors degree in a relevant field, with additional certifications in project management or data analytics being advantageous.

Interested? Share your updated CV

title: Business Operations Analyst, Business Intelligence
description:
Position Type: Full-Time
Department: Process Innovation / PP&T

Work Location: North York Office:
20 Norelco Drive, North York, ON M9L 2X6
Work Arrangement: Hybrid - 4 Days per Week On-Site
Work Hours: Monday-Friday, 8AM-5PM

At LG, we create Innovation for a Better Life.

We design products and services that make life better, easier, and more enjoyable. Whether it’s through smart functionality, design, or innovative technology, our home appliances, including kitchen, laundry and lifestyle solutions, media entertainment products including televisions, sound bars, projectors, computer monitors and laptops, to cutting-edge business solutions in IT, digital signage, and HVAC, we’re driven by one simple idea: to make Life Good.

As a global leader in consumer electronics, LG is committed not only to enriching the lives of our customers, but also to create rewarding experiences for our employees. We offer meaningful challenges, continuous learning opportunities, and a workplace culture that recognizes collaboration and rewards excellence.

Across our global network, LG employees share a common mission: to bring the Life’s Good promise to our customers by creating a better life for people, and a better future for our planet through our smart life solutions. Our relentless drive for innovation, combined with our culture of challenge and change, enables us to lead in today’s dynamic market.

At LG, Life’s Good.

As a Business Operations Analyst, you will serve as the key bridge between BI developers and business teams, including Sales, Marketing, Supply Chain, Finance, and Operations. The Business Operations Analyst will interpret business needs, translate them into technical requirements, and ensure BI solutions effectively support sales performance, operational efficiency, and strategic decision-making. This position also plays a critical role in organizing deliverables and reporting progress to upper management.

PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES:
Business Domain Analysis & Requirements Gathering:
• Collaborate with LG sales business teams to understand KPIs and data needs across sales operations, order-to-cash, pricing, promotions, forecasts, returns, and margin analysis.
• Identify business pain points and design BI-driven solutions that improve visibility into sales performance and operational processes.
• Gather and document functional requirements that align with business goals and reflect sales processes, system flows, and data dependencies.

Cross-Functional Communication & Technical Translation:
• Act as the communication bridge between business stakeholders and BI developers.
• Translate business requirements into clear technical specifications, ensuring BI developers understand context and objectives.
• Facilitate meetings, workshops, and design sessions to align expectations and clarify analytical logic.

Project Coordination & Delivery Management:
• Prioritize incoming BI requests based on business impact and urgency.
• Track progress, manage timelines, and escalate risks to ensure successful delivery of dashboards, data models, and system enhancements.
• Support testing efforts by coordinating UAT with business users and validating outputs against expected results.

Documentation & Process Standardization:
• Maintain comprehensive documentation including requirement specs, business process flows, data mappings, and reporting logic.
• Help standardize reporting metrics, definitions, and data governance practices across the sales subsidiary.
• Create user guides and training materials for new dashboards or data tools.

Management Reporting & Executive Communication:
• Prepare regular project updates, status reports, KPIs, and executive-level summaries for senior leadership.
• Communicate major milestones, risks, and decision points clearly to upper management.
• Provide insights that help management understand performance trends and key business drivers.

Business Insights & Continuous Improvement:
• Analyze sales, operational, and financial data to identify trends, inefficiencies, or anomalies.
• Recommend improvements to data models, business rules, and workflows to enhance accuracy and usability.
• Support business readiness for upcoming initiatives such as system migrations, process changes, or new reporting capabilities.
• Additional duties as assigned.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES:
• Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
• Excellent communication skills with the ability to work across business and technical teams.
• Proven experience as a Business Operations Analyst or similar role in a sales-driven environment.
• Experience mapping business processes and recommending improvements.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with high attention to detail.
• Self-motivated with the ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities.
• Strong organizational and time management skills to meet project deadlines.
• Experience with project management and documentation tools such as Jira, Confluence, Smartsheet, or SharePoint.
• Knowledge of data governance and data quality principles is an asset.
• Familiarity with sales processes, KPIs, channel/partner programs, and promotional structures is a plus.
• Bilingual in English/Korean is a strong asset

Note: This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Employee may perform other related duties as negotiated to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.

The organization offers an attractive compensation package that encompasses a competitive salary and excellent benefits.

Conditions of Employment:
It is the candidate’s sole responsibility to obtain any work permits/visas or other authorizations which may be required to legally work in Canada prior to commencing employment.

Equal Opportunity Employer:
LG Electronics Canada, Inc. is strongly committed to diversity and inclusion and aims to create a healthy, accessible, and rewarding work environment which highlights employees’ unique contributions to our company’s success. As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from all to help us build a diverse workforce which reflects the diversity of our customers, and communities, in which we live and serve. LG Electronics Canada, Inc., will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment, selection and/or assessment process to applicants with disabilities. If selected to participate in the recruitment, selection and/or assessment process, please inform LG’s Human Resources staff of the nature of any accommodation(s) that you may require in respect of any materials or processes.

LG Electronics Canada, Inc. thanks all candidates for their interest, however, only those selected to continue in the process will be contacted.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst III
description:
Work Location:
Toronto, Ontario, Canada

Hours:
37.5

Line of Business:
Analytics, Insights, & Artificial Intelligence

Pay Details:
$65,600 - $98,400 CAD

TD is committed to providing fair and equitable compensation opportunities to all colleagues. Growth opportunities and skill development are defining features of the colleague experience at TD. Our compensation policies and practices have been designed to allow colleagues to progress through the salary range over time as they progress in their role. The base pay actually offered may vary based upon the candidate's skills and experience, job-related knowledge, geographic location, and other specific business and organizational needs.

As a candidate, you are encouraged to ask compensation related questions and have an open dialogue with your recruiter who can provide you more specific details for this role.

Job Description:

The Business Intelligence Analyst III will work with the Wealth data and analytics team and be accountable for partnering with stakeholders and delivering timely, meaningful analytics solution, to support managing risk and ensuring regulatory and policy compliance. We are looking for a self-motivated and innovative individual who excels in a fast paced and high impact business team.

Primary Responsibilities:
• Work closely with business stakeholders to understand business objectives and requirements, design and execute on the analytical solutions in an accurate and timely fashion
• Work with various sources of data using Python, PySpark and other tools to generate analysis and reporting
• Develop insightful, functional and appealing data visualization via Tableau or Power BI dashboard to facilitate self-serve insights generation and actioning
• Provide value-added insights (both verbal and written) in the form of analysis, interpretation and advice to highlight further business opportunities
• Communicate with stakeholders and partners to deliver on milestones and to manage timelines and SLA
• Manage partner inquiries, problem resolution, providing updates and communication including presentation and training as necessary
• Actively contribute to enhancing the team's foundational and scalable processes and best practices for data extraction, manipulation, archiving, provision of insights, team de-risking needs and reporting development techniques
• Work effectively and efficiently in a fast paced, challenging data and technology environment that leverages multiple databases and tools
• Work individually or as a team leveraging each other's knowledge and expertise
• Contribute to a positive team dynamics including collaboration, sharing best practices and making it a great place to work

Job Requirements:

Qualifications/Skills/Experience:
• Over 2 years of work experience in analytics and reporting
• Sound to advanced PySpark coding skills
• Solid background working with data and conducting analysis or planning complex data flows and processes
• Strong interpersonal skills and ability to build relationships
• Proven ability to communicate quantitative/ qualitative information and key messages clearly.
• Detail oriented and ability to effectively manage work under tight timelines and changing priorities
• Disciplined with a proven track record of delivering results and executing with excellence
• Experience in working with TD's proprietary systems, processes and applications and/or a business analysis/reporting function would be considered an asset

Education:
• Post secondary degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering or other analytically based discipline

Technical Knowledge/Skills:
• 2+ years' experience in mining, analyzing and visualizing large amounts of data and programming skills using Python PySpark, SQL
• Familiar with Azure cloud, Databricks
• Experience with creating Tableau / Power BI dashboards

Who We Are:

TD is one of the world's leading global financial institutions and is the fifth largest bank in North America by branches/stores. Every day, we deliver legendary customer experiences to over 27 million households and businesses in Canada, the United States and around the world. More than 95,000 TD colleagues bring their skills, talent, and creativity to the Bank, those we serve, and the economies we support. We are guided by our vision to Be the Better Bank and our purpose to enrich the lives of our customers, communities and colleagues.

TD is deeply committed to being a leader in customer experience, that is why we believe that all colleagues, no matter where they work, are customer facing. As we build our business and deliver on our strategy, we are innovating to enhance the customer experience and build capabilities to shape the future of banking. Whether you've got years of banking experience or are just starting your career in financial services, we can help you realize your potential. Through regular leadership and development conversations to mentorship and training programs, we're here to support you towards your goals. As an organization, we keep growing - and so will you.

Our Total Rewards Package
Our Total Rewards package reflects the investments we make in our colleagues to help them and their families achieve their financial, physical, and mental well-being goals. Total Rewards at TD includes a base salary, variable compensation, and several other key plans such as health and well-being benefits, savings and retirement programs, paid time off, banking benefits and discounts, career development, and reward and recognition programs. Learn more

Additional Information:
We're delighted that you're considering building a career with TD. Through regular development conversations, training programs, and a competitive benefits plan, we're committed to providing the support our colleagues need to thrive both at work and at home.

Please be advised that this job opportunity is subject to provincial regulation for employment purposes. It is imperative to acknowledge that each province or territory within the jurisdiction of Canada may have its own set of regulations, requirements.

Colleague Development
If you're interested in a specific career path or are looking to build certain skills, we want to help you succeed. You'll have regular career, development, and performance conversations with your manager, as well as access to an online learning platform and a variety of mentoring programs to help you unlock future opportunities. Whether you have a passion for helping customers and want to expand your experience, or you want to coach and inspire your colleagues, there are many different career paths within our organization at TD - and we're committed to helping you identify opportunities that support your goals.

Training & Onboarding
We will provide training and onboarding sessions to ensure that you've got everything you need to succeed in your new role.

Interview Process
We'll reach out to candidates of interest to schedule an interview. We do our best to communicate outcomes to all applicants by email or phone call.

Accommodation
Your accessibility is important to us. Please let us know if you'd like accommodations (including accessible meeting rooms, captioning for virtual interviews, etc.) to help us remove barriers so that you can participate throughout the interview process.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Language Requirement (Quebec only):
Sans Objet

title: Senior Analyst, Business Intelligence
description:
Location:

1685 Tech Ave, Mississauga, Ontario, L4W 0A7

At Shoppers Drug Mart, we’re innovating health and wellness in Canada. From prescriptions to walk-in clinics, and a beloved loyalty program, we’re caring and supporting our customers in new ways every day.

With more than 1,300 locally owned and operated stores from coast to coast, the Shoppers Drug Mart network is more than a great place to shop, it’s a great place to work. We’re committed to building our talented team who champion collaboration, kindness and inclusivity. Join our team, and help recognize a healthy future for your career and for all Canadians.

Why this role is important?

The Senior Analyst, Reporting position’s primary responsibility will be to help extract & analyze all patient assistance program data within core therapeutic areas and provide value add insight into trends, opportunities, performance to targets and benchmarks for programs and recommendations on efficiencies. The Senior Analyst’s role is to assist the business users in getting raw data out of the system to turn into something meaningful for stakeholders. They will also act as a liaison for communication between the business end users and the developers.

The incumbent will work with internal staff to develop and maintain comprehensive reporting for SDM Specialty Health Network Management and external clients.

What you will do:
• Act as a conduit between: Client, SHN Sales & Marketing and Business Intelligence department to clarify and translate business and or operational requirements into documentation and conceptual report designs
• Recommend and facilitate development of reports (regular & ad-hoc)
• Develop, run, validate and review reports, analyze trends, monitor and maximize operational excellence, and summarize analyses for report end users which includes internal employees and clients
• Deliver said analysis & reports in the most effective way possible for the audience
• Develop financial analysis and reports designed to maximize profitability
• Develop supporting invoice data and queries
• Maintain business requirements, functional requirements and technical specification documentation for all reports
• Participate in audits on behalf of the Business Intelligence department
• Participate in Request for Proposal processes related to specific therapeutic area of expertise
• Assess impact to reports due to process changes and improvements
• Report all Adverse Events (AE) and Product Technical Complaints (PTC) immediately or as soon as possible upon becoming aware of the event as per current policies and procedure

What you will need:
• Business/Computer Science/Engineering Degree or equivalent working experience
• A minimum of 3-7 years’ experience preferably in a pharmaceutical industry
• Strong knowledge and understanding of SQL is a key skill
• Effective organizational, communication and customer relations skills
• Well-developed analytical and problem-solving skills
• Familiarity with CRM platforms (SalesForce)
• Exceptional computer skills (MS Excel and quantitative & statistical analysis tools)
• Experience with Business Intelligence Platforms (i.e. Tableau, PowerBI, etc.)
• Must be able manage time effectively through flexibility & prioritization
• Must enjoy working in an environment of fast paced change and ambiguity

Why work at Shoppers Drug Mart?

Acting as consultants, supporting internal customers and the Associate-Owners, you will get experience unique to the retail industry while working for an award-winning national brand. Benefit from a purchase discount program, competitive pay and online learning through Academy.

Take ownership of your work and find more ways to care about your work, co-workers, customers and community.

How You’ll Succeed:

At Shoppers Drug Mart Inc., we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections.

If that sounds like you, and you are open-minded, responsive to change and up to the challenges provided in a fast-paced retail environment, apply today.

Employment Type:

Full time

Type of Role:

Regular

Shoppers Drug Mart Inc. recognizes Canada’s diversity as a source of national pride and strength. We have made it a priority to reflect our nation’s evolving diversity in the products we sell, the people we hire, and the culture we create in our organization. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities in the recruitment and assessment process and when hired.

In addition, we believe that compliance with laws is about doing the right thing. Upholding the law is part of our Code of Conduct – it reinforces what our customers and stakeholders expect of us.

Please Note: If you have Employee Self Service (ESS) on Workday, apply to this job via the Workday application.

#EN

#SS #ON

title: Business Information Management Specialist (Data Enablement)
description:
Business Information Management Specialist III (Data Enablement)

Contract Opportunity

Location: Toronto, ON (Hybrid – 4 days/week onsite starting February 2026)

Office: 79 Wellington Street West

Role Overview

The Business Information Management Specialist III will support a compliance-focused data enablement team responsible for reporting, documentation, and testing within a regulated financial services environment. This role provides end-to-end business intelligence, data transformation, and technical documentation support for compliance reporting initiatives tied to enterprise regulatory frameworks.

This is a hands-on senior individual contributor role requiring strong Python and Power BI expertise, deep experience with data flows and transformations, and the ability to independently manage deliverables while collaborating with technical and business stakeholders.

Key Responsibilities
• Develop, enhance, and support dashboards, reports, and scorecards using Power BI
• Execute reporting tasks including data refreshes, analysis, and ad hoc requests
• Design, document, and support complex data transformations and data flows (ETL)
• Create and maintain high-quality technical documentation and testing documentation for data pipelines and BI solutions
• Support delivery of new data and reporting solutions through testing, validation, and documentation
• Troubleshoot data, reporting, and pipeline issues as part of daily operational support
• Analyze data requirements and translate business needs into technical solutions
• Work independently while collaborating closely with a small, growing team

Required Qualifications
• 5–7 years of relevant experience in data analytics, business intelligence, or information management
• Expert-level Python experience (5+ years)
• Expert-level Power BI experience (5+ years)
• Strong experience documenting complex technical solutions and data transformations
• Proven experience creating and maintaining testing documentation for data pipelines and visualizations
• Hands-on experience with data mapping, data flows, and technical data transformation
• Strong analytical, problem-solving, and troubleshooting skills
• Ability to clearly communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders

Nice-to-Have Skills
• Experience developing workflow or automation tools using Microsoft Power Platform (Power Apps / Power Automate)
• Experience with Databricks
• Prior experience in financial services, compliance, or regulatory reporting environments

title: Senior Business Analyst : Power Apps & BI Leader
description:
A financial organization in Toronto is seeking a Senior Business Analyst to lead business analysis processes for significant projects. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, manage configurations on Microsoft Power Apps, and produce key documentation ensuring project success. The ideal candidate has over 10 years of experience in business analysis and strong skills in translating business needs into technical specifications. This role includes a flexible / hybrid work environment and opportunities for professional growth.

#J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Web Designer
description:
We are seeking a talented and innovative Web Designer to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for creating visually compelling, user-friendly websites and digital experiences that align with our brand identity and business goals. This role requires a strong foundation in both graphic and web design, combined with technical skills in front-end development and user experience (UX) principles. The Web Designer will collaborate closely with developers, marketers, and stakeholders to deliver engaging digital solutions that enhance user engagement and drive online success.

Responsibilities
• Design and develop responsive websites using tools such as Adobe XD, Figma, Sketch, and InVision.
• Create engaging visual content including graphics, logos, motion graphics, and UI elements using Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, After Effects, InDesign).
• Implement website layouts and features utilizing HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Bootstrap, Angular, React, Node.js, and other front-end technologies.
• Optimize websites for SEO performance using best practices in web accessibility and usability standards.
• Conduct user research and usability testing to improve website functionality and user experience (UX/UI).
• Maintain and update existing websites built on platforms such as WordPress, Drupal, SharePoint, or custom CMS solutions.
• Collaborate with developers to integrate data analysis tools like Google Analytics and Adobe Analytics for performance tracking.
• Ensure website security, accessibility compliance, and cross-browser compatibility.
• Participate in information architecture planning and wireframing to enhance site navigation and overall user experience.
• Stay current with industry trends in digital design, web development frameworks like AJAX, LESS/SCSS stylesheets, Redux state management, and emerging technologies such as Web Accessibility standards.

Qualifications
• Proven experience in digital design with a strong portfolio showcasing website projects.
• Proficiency in graphic design tools including Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, After Effects, Adobe Creative Suite (including Adobe Acrobat), Figma, Sketch, Balsamiq.
• Solid understanding of front-end development languages: HTML5, CSS3 (including SCSS), JavaScript (including AJAX), PHP.
• Experience working with content management systems such as WordPress or Drupal.
• Knowledge of web accessibility standards (WCAG), usability testing methods, and information architecture principles.
• Familiarity with analytics tools like Google Analytics and Adobe Analytics to interpret data for continuous improvement.
• Skills in interaction design, visual design (UI/UX), typography, motion graphics, and digital marketing strategies including email marketing campaigns via Mailchimp or similar platforms.
• Experience with version control systems such as Git; familiarity with frameworks like Angular or React is a plus.
• Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to analyze data for insights using Python or data analysis tools is desirable.
• Excellent communication skills to collaborate effectively across teams and present ideas clearly. Join us as a Web Designer to craft innovative digital experiences that captivate users while advancing your career in a fast-paced creative environment!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $42,511.14-$74,369.49 per year

Benefits:
• Life insurance
• Paid time off
• RRSP match

Work Location: In person

title: Freelance Website Designer
description:
JOB TYPE: FREELANCE (REMOTE / WORK FROM HOME)

COMPENSATION: Starting at $28/hr

THE ROLE:

Do you love transforming businesses and brands into the online world? Do you enjoy working with clients from various industries and of all sizes? Do you call yourself a web design wizard or WordPress expert? If you answered yes to these questions, then this is the position for you! Web Sharx works in a unique and fast-paced environment, servicing various clients by embracing new ways of thinking to reach businesses (B2B) and consumers (B2C) most effectively. Learn more and join our team today!

RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Effectively meet client objectives and needs through the use of website design tools
• Ability to work with cross-functional partners and team members
• Open and willing to accept constructive feedback from clients and implement solutions to effectively action against feedback
• Very responsive and attentive throughout the entire timeline of client projects, providing updates to the team
• Ability to validate functional requirements of each project and provide key recommendations
• Strives to stay up to date with the latest technology and software to keep ahead of website development trends and changes

REQUIREMENTS AND QUALIFICATIONS:
• A minimum of 3 years experience as a website designer or related position
• Completed or currently completing a business or technology degree at an educational institution
• Expert in WordPress, Shopify and related content-management systems
• Experienced in writing codes: HTML5, CSS3, PHP, JavaScript
• Experienced with mobile-responsive and cross-browser designs
• Established background in graphic design tools such as Adobe Creative Suite
• Understanding of company’s core competencies and knowledge of the website development industry
• Extremely detail-oriented and organized
• Great decision making skills and avid problem-solver
• Excellent writing, speaking and communication skills
• Interested in the technology industry!

title: Web Designer / Frontend Developer
description:
About the Role

We are seeking a talented and detail-oriented Web Designer / Frontend Developer to join our creative team. This role bridges design and development — ideal for someone who can translate beautiful UI/UX concepts from Figma into fully functional, responsive websites built on WordPress and Shopify.

You’ll collaborate closely with our brand strategists, designers, and developers to bring brand experiences to life through thoughtful digital design and seamless user interaction.

Key Responsibilities
• Design visually engaging and user-friendly website interfaces in Figma, following brand guidelines and UX principles.
• Develop responsive front-end pages using WordPress and Shopify, ensuring cross-browser and device compatibility.
• Convert Figma layouts and prototypes into pixel-perfect, production-ready web pages.
• Customize and maintain WordPress themes and Shopify templates using HTML, CSS, JavaScript (and Liquid for Shopify).
• Implement animations, micro-interactions, and UI effects to enhance user experience.
• Optimize site speed, SEO structure, and accessibility standards.
• Collaborate with the creative and content teams to ensure consistent design language across digital touchpoints.
• Troubleshoot and resolve front-end issues in real-time.
• Stay up to date with the latest trends in UI/UX design, web technology, and creative tools.

Qualifications & Skills
• Diploma or Bachelor’s degree in Graphic/Web Design, Computer Science, Interactive Media, or related field.
• 1+ years of experience in web design and front-end development (agency experience preferred).
• Proficient in Figma, WordPress, and Shopify.
• Solid understanding of HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, jQuery, Liquid, and responsive frameworks.
• Familiarity with UI/UX principles, wireframing, and usability testing.
• Experience with SEO-friendly front-end coding and website optimization.
• Knowledge of version control systems (e.g., Github) is a plus.
• Strong sense of aesthetics, typography, and attention to detail.
• Able to manage multiple projects and meet tight deadlines.
• Curious and proactive about new web technologies and AI-assisted design tools.

Bonus Skills
• Experience in Shopify App integration and WordPress plugin customization.
• Basic understanding of PHP or React/Vue.js.
• Animation/motion design experience.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $40,000.00 per year

Work Location: In person

title: Project Manager, OPL (PL Transformation)
description:
Our employees are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we help people, businesses, and society prosper in good times and be resilient in bad times.

Our employee promise represents Intact’s commitment to you in exchange for living our Values, striving to do your best work, being open to change and investing in your career. In return, we promise to provide support, opportunities and performance-led financial rewards at a workplace where you can shape the future, win as a team and grow with us.

About the role

At Intact, we are at the forefront of launching innovative initiatives designed to drive our performance. Our growing team is committed to delivering strategic projects that align with our company's goals and mission. To support these key projects, we are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Project Manager to join our team. In this role, you will play a crucial part in initiating and executing multiple projects, collaborating closely with managers to define project objectives, scope, and deliverables. Your influence and strategic vision will drive collaboration across multiple teams and ensure effective project delivery.

What you’ll do here:
• Project Initiation and Planning: Lead the scoping, planning, and initiation of projects, providing clarity and structure to ensure projects start on the right foot. Develop and maintain comprehensive project plans that include deliverables, timelines, costs, and resource capacity planning.
• Strategic Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams to execute project plans, ensuring effective communication and collaboration across all levels.
• Stakeholder Engagement: Build and maintain strong working relationships with internal and external stakeholders, including presenting project updates and results to senior executives.
• Risk and Issue Management: Proactively identify project risks and issues, implementing effective mitigation strategies and ensuring governance is in place for timely resolution.
• Project Monitoring: Facilitate project meetings, create and deliver presentations on project milestones, budget expenditures, and status updates, and ensure project progress aligns with corporate standards.
• Methodology and Tools: Ensure the appropriate project management methodologies are applied throughout the project lifecycle and provide the team with the tools they need to succeed.

What you bring to the table:
• At least 3 years of experience in a Project Manager role, and a total of 5 years of experience in project management.
• Experience working in a large company, with successful management of complex projects involving multiple stakeholders and multifaceted processes.
• Strong proficiency in Agile methodology and project management tools, including the MS Office Suite, JIRA, and Confluence.
• A clear strategic vision with the ability to influence and manage change through effective communication skills.
• Strong interpersonal, analytical, problem-solving, and motivational skills, with an ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
• Demonstrated ability to build relationships and negotiate to achieve project consensus and support.
• No Canadian work experience required however must be eligible to work in Canada.
• For candidates located in Quebec, bilingualism is required considering the necessity to interact on a regular basis with English-speaking colleagues across the country

title: Technical Project Manager
description:
Come make your difference in communities across Canada, where authenticity, trust and making connections is valued – as we shape the future of Canadian retail, together. Our unique position as one of the country's largest employers, coupled with our commitment to positively impact the lives of all Canadians, provides our colleagues a range of opportunities and experiences to help Canadians Live Life Well®.

At Loblaw Companies Limited, we succeed through collaboration and commitment and set a high bar for ourselves and those around us. Whether you are just starting your career, re-entering the workforce, or looking for a new job, this is where you belong.

Does working with some of Canada’s most talented minds in innovation supporting retail, digital consumer solutions and analytical platforms excite you? Loblaw Technology powers some of Canada’s most game-changing retail solutions, giving our customers the ability to live their lives well.

Come work with a team that values diverse ideas, fosters a culture of inclusion and develops our talent from within. Loblaw Technology gives you the chance to excel and helps you to strive for success in a big way. Keep reading to learn more!

Please note Loblaw's Return to Office Policy, is 4 days in the office

Technical Project Manager | Brampton, ON

Loblaw Technology and Analytics is looking for an experienced, dedicated Technical Project Manager to lead various IT projects across our portfolio. In this role, you will be responsible for directing project staff and managing all aspects of the Project Management and Systems Development Life Cycle (SDLC).

As a Technical Project Manager, you will be accountable for the overall delivery of projects on time, on budget, and on scope. You will work collaboratively with business units and technical teams to meet strategic priorities, integrating technology, people, and process streams to ensure project success. By working closely with internal stakeholders and external vendors, you will gain the confidence of the business by providing stable systems, delivering with a sense of urgency, and navigating business changes effectively. As a key leader, you will play a crucial role in driving the evolution of our technology landscape.

We are passionate about what we do and support each other’s growth! You will learn and grow with the team and will have the opportunity to work on a diverse set of challenges as you shape your career.

What You’ll Do:
• Lead the end-to-end delivery of technology projects, ensuring they are completed on time, within budget, and to the agreed-upon scope in alignment with the product vision.
• Develop and maintain comprehensive project documentation, including status reports, project plans, and budget trackers, communicating progress to all stakeholders.
• Guide, coach, and motivate cross-functional project teams, fostering open communication and a collaborative environment to ensure project success.
• Serve as the primary liaison between internal business stakeholders, technical teams, and external vendors to define requirements, manage expectations, and ensure clear communication.
• Proactively manage project risks, issues, and inter-dependencies, integrate work across teams and oversee project budgets, escalating concerns as necessary to ensure timely resolution.
• Ensure established business and technology processes are followed while adapting to the unique needs of each project.
• Facilitate Scrum events, support product owner and promote agile principles throughout teams.

What You Bring:
• Extensive experience in IT Project Management, with a proven track record of successfully delivering complex technical projects.
• A post-secondary degree in a relevant field or equivalent professional experience.
• Deep understanding of the full Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and the flexibility to apply different project management methodologies (e.g., Agile, Waterfall) as needed.
• Demonstrated expertise in core project management competencies: strategic planning, budget and timeline management, scope control, risk mitigation, and effective team leadership.
• Proficiency with project management software such as MS Project, Jira, or Confluence, as well as MS Office tools (Excel, Word, Visio).
• Exceptional interpersonal, leadership, and communication skills, with the ability to work effectively in a multi-functional environment and manage stakeholder expectations.
• A high degree of adaptability and resilience, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and navigate a fast-paced, evolving environment.
• Proven experience delivering technology projects within the retail industry is an asset.
• Practical experience in a Scrum Master role, guiding teams using Agile principles and methodologies (“nice to have”).

If you’re up to the challenge, then we would love to hear from you. Apply today, and get the process started.

Loblaw recognizes Canada's diversity as a source of national pride and strength. We have made it a priority to reflect our nation’s evolving diversity in the products we sell, the people we hire, and the culture we create in our organization. At Loblaw, we celebrate diversity and strive to build a culture of inclusion where differences are embraced, valued and supported. We are committed to being an equal opportunity employer and encourage people from all backgrounds and identities to apply to our jobs. Accommodation in the recruitment, assessment, and hiring process is available upon request for applicants with disabilities.

We thank all candidates for their interest but please note, those candidates who meet the minimum requirements for the position will be contacted.

www.Loblaw.ca/careers

Our commitment to Sustainability and Social Impact is an essential part of the way we do business, and we focus our attention on areas where we can have the greatest impact. Our approach to sustainability and social impact is based on three pillars – Environment, Sourcing and Community – and we are constantly looking for ways to demonstrate leadership in these important areas. Our CORE Values – Care, Ownership, Respect and Excellence – guide all our decision-making and come to life through our Blue Culture. We offer our colleagues progressive careers, comprehensive training, flexibility, and other competitive benefits – these are some of the many reasons why we are one of Canada’s Top Employers, Canada’s Best Diversity Employers, Canada’s Greenest Employers & Canada’s Top Employers for Young People.

If you are unsure whether your experience matches every requirement above, we encourage you to apply anyway. We are looking for varied perspectives which include diverse experiences that we can add to our team.

We have a long-standing focus on diversity, equity and inclusion because we know it will make our company a better place to work and shop. We are committed to creating accessible environments for our colleagues, candidates and customers. Requests for accommodation due to a disability (which may be visible or invisible, temporary or permanent) can be made at any stage of application and employment. We encourage candidates to make their accommodation needs known so that we can provide equitable opportunities.

Please Note:
Candidates who are 18 years or older are required to complete a criminal background check. Details will be provided through the application process.

#SS #LTnA #ON

title: Sr. Project Manager - T&D
description:
You’ve Never Been Satisfied with “Good Enough.”

You want to make an impact, not just manage projects, but change how the world gets built. At Accenture Infrastructure & Capital Projects, you’ll do exactly that. You’ll help develop and deliver the factories, grids, transit systems, and public infrastructure that keep communities moving - and do it smarter, safer, and more sustainably than ever before.

You’ll work alongside people who think big and act bold - project managers, engineers, technologists, and strategists who blend real-world experience with digital innovation and AI. Together, we’re transforming how capital projects are planned, managed, and executed, creating a better way to build for the future.

Because “good enough” builds the past. You’re here to build what’s next, on a team that outperforms every norm.

Visit us here to learn more about Accenture Infrastructure & Capital Projects
• (Internal title: Project Management IV)
• Manage and implement the assigned projects from inception through to completion
• Develop new project or program plans and expectations in consultation with and delegating deliverables to stakeholders, including clients
• Determine and manage the human and material resources required to complete assigned projects successfully
• Formulate a resource allocation strategy and utilize this to distribute work and budgets
• Exercise authority in managing the work and control the delivery of the projects per project plans
• Review and ensure adherence to the overall scope, schedule, and budget
• Identify risks and entrench mitigation strategies and contingency plans
• Monitor and report on performance against project requirements, schedule, milestones, budgets, quality measures, and KPIs, and address issues with corrective actions as appropriate to ensure excellence and adherence to specified deadlines
• Evaluate the project's effectiveness by consulting with clients and other stakeholders
• Establish and deliver progress reports, proposals, and presentations to various audiences, including the project team, client executives, key stakeholders, and Operations
• Lead scope change negotiations
• Oversee ongoing quality control, participate in quality issue resolution, and manage internal quality control checks for the project
• Define success criteria and disseminate them to involved parties throughout the project and program life cycle
• Complete any tasks assigned by manager or higher in an efficient and timely manner
• Lead the planning, design, and execution of Transmission & Distribution (T&D) projects, including substations, overhead and underground transmission lines, and distribution networks
• Identify and pursue opportunities for additional business with the client, including upselling services and expanding project scopes
• Collaborate with internal teams to develop proposals, presentations, and strategies to secure new business opportunities
• Provide insights into market trends and client needs to inform business development strategies and enhance service offerings
• Ensure compliance with utility regulations, safety standards, and environmental requirements in all project phases
• Collaborate with utility companies, regulatory bodies, and stakeholders to align project goals with industry standards and client expectations
• Manage the integration of renewable energy sources into T&D systems, ensuring grid stability and reliability
• Oversee the implementation of advanced technologies, such as smart grids, SCADA systems, and energy storage solutions, to enhance operational efficiency
• Conduct risk assessments specific to T&D projects, including grid reliability, load forecasting, and system resilience
• Provide technical leadership and mentorship to project teams specializing in T&D infrastructure
• Working Conditions
• Office-based (hybrid)

title: Project Manager – Marketing
description:
PROTOCOL SPORTS MARKETING LTD., (Part of the Protocol Group) a well-established, international sports media rights distribution company, is looking to add a motivated and tenacious self-starter to its fast-expanding team.

We are a growing company working in midtown Toronto looking for a Project Manager – MARKETING to support our international marketing operations, partner relations, and media rights initiatives.

Key Responsibilities

Marketing, Digital & Social Media
• Develop and execute marketing, digital, email, and social media strategies to promote company initiatives and sports media properties.
• Maintain and update company social media accounts, ensuring consistent branding and audience engagement.
• Manage and update the company CRM and internal databases.
• Prepare or oversee the preparation of marketing collateral, including presentations, briefs, newsletters, press releases, website content, and promotional material.
• Conduct market research to support marketing strategies and business development.
• Lead website management, including design concepts, content updates, and digital asset organization.
• Generate new marketing and promotional ideas to support company growth.

Public Relations
• Develop and implement PR strategies for clients, partners, and public audiences.
• Support interviews, media interactions, and act as a spokesperson when required.
• Attend and coordinate trade shows, conferences, meetings, and promotional events.

Project & Client/Partner Management / Sports Media Rights & Contract Coordination
• Lead and manage marketing-related projects, ensuring timelines and deliverables are met.
• Assist in business development and maintain partner/client relations with promoters, producers, federations, rights holders, broadcasters, and streaming services worldwide.
• Assist internal teams with deal memos, rights documentation, contract processing, and digital asset management.
• Coordinate promotional materials with sports federations, promoters, rights holders, and provide these materials to broadcasters and streaming platforms.
• Support the organization and tracking of sports media rights, contractual obligations, and rights-related documentation.

Requirements
• Minimum of 3 years of experience in a full-service sports marketing company in marketing, project management, or client relations.
• A university degree or college diploma in business marketing, public relations, communications, journalism, museology or a discipline related
• Experience working with international clients across multiple regions and familiarity with sports markets worldwide.
• Strong understanding of global sports properties, federations, and broadcast environments.
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with experience preparing professional marketing and PR materials.
• Proficiency in digital marketing, social media management, CRM systems, and project coordination.
• Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.

Employment Details
• Salary: CAD $ 37.50 p/h
• Hours of Work: 30 hours per week
• Employment Type: Full-time, permanent

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Pay: $37.50 per hour

Expected hours: 30 per week

Benefits:
• On-site parking

Work Location: In person
